body_html:
I managed to suppress all the warnings with this.

# https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/7778
# TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL is a TensorFlow environment variable responsible for the logs, 
# to silence INFO logs set it to 1, to filter out WARNING 2 and to additionally silence ERROR logs (not recommended) set it to 3
import os
os.environ['TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL']='2'

import numpy as np
import tensorflow as tf

# supress 'monitor' warnings...
# https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/monitors
tf.logging.set_verbosity(tf.logging.ERROR)

I managed to suppress all the warnings with this.
# https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/7778
# TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL is a TensorFlow environment variable responsible for the logs, 
# to silence INFO logs set it to 1, to filter out WARNING 2 and to additionally silence ERROR logs (not recommended) set it to 3
import os

import numpy as np
import tensorflow as tf

# supress 'monitor' warnings...
# https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/monitors
tf.logging.set_verbosity(tf.logging.ERROR)
body:
I managed to suppress all the warnings with this.  

```
# https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/7778
# TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL is a TensorFlow environment variable responsible for the logs, 
# to silence INFO logs set it to 1, to filter out WARNING 2 and to additionally silence ERROR logs (not recommended) set it to 3
import os
os.environ['TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL']='2'

import numpy as np
import tensorflow as tf

# supress 'monitor' warnings...
# https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/monitors
tf.logging.set_verbosity(tf.logging.ERROR)
```
